intro: Codonoboea bakoensis, commonly known as the Bako mountain morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the highland regions of Cameroon. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many vines and climbers. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pale blue to violet in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
